newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER SHOWCASE-DORTMUND TRIO FACE LATE FITNESS TESTS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-DORTMUND TRIO FACE LATE FITNESS TESTS.

text.p: European Cup semifinalists Borussia Dortmund have been hit by injury worries ahead of Saturday's German first division clash with Borussia Moenchengladbach in Dortmund.
Experienced international defender Juergen Kohler, Portuguese midfielder Paulo Sousa and striker Karlheinz Riedle are all doubtful.
Kohler, whose contract was extended on Friday to 1999, has been complaining of neck pains since his side's 1-0 midweek victory over French side Auxerre in the European Cup.
Sousa has a leg injury and Riedle has been struggling with a groin strain.
Reigning champions and league leaders Dortmund should pick up three points against 13th-placed Moenchengladbach.

But Ottmar Hitzfeld's team, who are just ahead of Bayern Munich on goal difference at the top of the Bundesliga, need to turn their minds away from their European success if they want to win a third consecutive championship.

"Success in Europe causes a lot of distractions," Dortmund chairman Gerd Niebaum said. "For that reason we are going to have to show eagerness to perform again and again in the next period if we want to keep alive our hopes of a third championship."
Moenchengladbach, led by talented former German international Stefan Effenberg, have been showing good form lately and are playing a lot better than their lowly position suggests.
They will be without suspended Romanian midfielder Ioan Lupescu but should have their key performers Effenberg and Swedish striker Martin Dahlin in their ranks.
